abstract: The $100 billion deal would create a brewing giant accounting for 27 percent of beer sales worldwide, with annual revenue of about $55 billion.
snippet: The $100 billion deal would create a brewing giant accounting for 27 percent of beer sales worldwide, with annual revenue of about $55 billion.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Shareholders of SABMiller and Anheuser-Busch InBev on Wednesday approved a deal valued at more than $100 billion to create a giant in the beer industry that would control some of the world’s best-known brands, including Budweiser, Corona, Hoegaarden, Leffe and Stella Artois.

headline.main: Shareholders Approve SABMiller Takeover by Anheuser-Busch InBev
